snippet: A Frank Lloyd Wright house in Arizona, under threat of demolition by the luxury home developers who now own it, may have a new buyer, and savior.
abstract: Anonymous buyer agrees to pay asking price of $2.379 million for 1952 Frank Lloyd Wright house in Phoenix that has been under threat of demolition since its sale to pair of luxury home developers; agreement keeps house from being razed, but is only first step in ensuring that building passes home inspection and is given landmark status by city.
lead_paragraph: A Frank Lloyd Wright house in Arizona, under threat of demolition by the luxury home developers who now own it, may have a new buyer, and savior.

headline.seo: A New Buyer Appears for a Threatened Wright House
headline.main: A New Buyer Appears for a Threatened Wright House
headline.print_headline: A New Buyer Appears for a Threatened Wright House
